title: Needed, similar typeface to Melior/Renault
content:
A while after working on Verona   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/870.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/870.html)   
I came across another typeface with similar features. Only now I can't remember what it was.   
It was in the vein of Melior, Renault, Century, and was suitable for text setting.   
Any suggestions greatly appreciated
author: miles

comments.content:
Kepler?   
It has a width axis, and maybe you saw a narrow instance?   
   
Dunno, could be anything, almost. What else do you remember?   
What was the "a" like? Maybe hypnosis would trigger some recollection. ;-)   
   
hhp

Searching a bit, I found Zapf himself did [Edison](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.linotype.com/351/edison-family.html) and also [Marconi](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.linotype.com/1210/marconi-family.html). Both show the influence of his earlier Melior. Could you have seen one of these?

I remember the curved characters (top of the a, the c, s, etc) had squared terminals, much like Verona. Thanks William for Edison, I was not aware of it, though it's not the face that I had in mind, but a valuable resource for this style.

Maybe ' [RePublic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=rePublic)', by Tom� Brousil / [Suitcase Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/).?   
_( Based on a original type design by Stanislav Mar�o )_   
   
 [http://www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=rePublic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en&section=font&font=rePublic)   
   
_( [PDF Sample, 'RePublic'](http://web.archive.org/web/20050824025051/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/images/font/rePublic/01_RePublic_Book-new.pdf) )_
